Instance.description: The instance tuning for object parts, which can be shared between objects, contains information like support posture part, slot information and interaction just for parts.

TunableList.name: blacklisted_buffs
TunableList.description: A list of buffs that will disable this part as a candidate to run an interaction.

Tunable.description: Reference to a buff to disable the part.

Tunable.name: can_pick
Tunable.description: If checked, this part can be picked (selected as target when clicking on object.) If unchecked, cannot be picked.

Tunable.name: on_owning_part_surface
Tunable.description: If checked, this object is considered on top of the owning object's routing surface when generating constraints. For instance, the enclosure in the Treehouse needs constaints built on the Treehouse routing surface.

TunableVariant.name: part_surface
TunableVariant.description: The rules to determine the surface type for this object.

TunableTuple.name: override_surface
TunableTuple.description: Part will use the tuned override surface type

TunableEnum.name: override_surface_type
TunableEnum.description: The override for the surface type. If used, part owner's surface type will be ignored.

TunableTuple.name: part_owner
TunableTuple.description: Part will use the part owners's surface type. If parent has no routing surface, return None

TunableList.name: portal_data
TunableList.description: If the object owning this part has a portal component tuned, the specified portals will be created for each part of this type. The root position of the part is the subroot position.

Tunable.description: A reference to a PortalData tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: subroot
Tunable.description: The reference of the subroot definition in the part.

TunableTuple.name: supported_affordance_data
TunableTuple.description: Define affordance compatibility for this part.

TunableVariant.name: compatibility
TunableVariant.description: Affordances supported by the part (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.)

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: consider_mixers
Tunable.description: If checked, mixers are filtered through this compatibility check. If unchecked, all mixers are assumed to be valid to run on this part.

TunableVariant.name: supported_posture_types
TunableVariant.description: The postures supported by this part. If empty, assumes all postures are supported. (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a PostureTypeList tuning snippet.)

Tunable.name: posture_type
Tunable.description: Posture that is supported by this object.

TunableVariant.name: required_clearance
TunableVariant.description: Amount of clearance you need in front of the object or part for this posture to be supported.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Amount of clearance you need in front of the object or part for this posture to be supported.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a PostureTypeList tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: trait_requirements
TunableTuple.description: Trait blacklist and whitelist requirements to pick this part.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.
